content.webTitle: Pick of the week: Rock and pop

fields.headline: Pick of the week: Rock and pop
fields.bodyText: Kylie 02 Arena, SE10 Saturday 2, Monday 4 Diminutive Australian songstress Minogue the elder returns, armed with some Scissor Sisters-reminiscent material. Game not over yet, you know. Cornelius Shepherd's Bush Empire, W12 Sunday 3 Eclectic Japanese musician brings intermittently inspirational stuff to the capital. Cause for celebration among thirty-something record baggers. Reverend Horton Heat Astoria 2, WC2 Wednesday 6 The Reverend Jim and his band celebrate 20 years of Sub Pop with their enduringly feisty hard rockabilly. Watch for the great 400 Bucks. Madness Sandown Park Racecourse, KT10 Thursday 7 The bards of Camden Town return with a new, bizarre, London-themed album, The Liberty Of Newton Folgate. Hits, funny glasses, etc come too. A Sunny Day In Glasgow The Luminaire, NW6 Saturday 2 Quality indie pop is the order of the day here, while support comes from the epic and experimental Working For A Nuclear Free City.
